OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupHarderOres
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for the vanilla Minecraft ores in the harder variety.

Choice.Description: Single short, wide veins found near ground level and only sparsely filled with ore. Most common in swamps.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in swamps.
Small evenly scattered clusters of ore. This is the vanilla coal generation.

Choice.description: No coal is generated at all.

Choice.Description: Groups of long narrow veins found about one third of the way down to bedrock. Especially common in snowy or icy areas.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in snowy or icy areas.
Small evenly scattered clusters of ore. This is the vanilla iron generation.

Choice.description: No iron is generated at all.

Choice.Description: Groups of long narrow veins found about two thirds of the way down to bedrock. Most common in temperate hardwood forests, but still very rare.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in temperate hardwood forests.
Small clusters of ore scattered evenly from bedrock about halfway to the surface. This is the vanilla gold generation.

Choice.description: No gold is generated at all.

Choice.Description: Single vertical veins starting near the surface and extending down about halfway to bedrock. Most common in desert climates.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only in desert climates.
Small clusters of ore scattered evenly from bedrock about one quarter of the way to the surface. This is the vanilla redstone generation.

Choice.description: No redstone is generated at all.

Choice.Description: Short lava-filled tubes extending upward from bedrock with diamonds around the edges.
Uncommon, sparsely populated clouds of ore covering roughly one chunk.
Small clusters of ore scattered evenly from bedrock about one quarter of the way to the surface. This is the vanilla diamond generation.

Choice.description: No diamonds are generated at all.

OptionChoice.name: lapisDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Lapis Lazuli is generated

Choice.Description: Single vertical veins starting near bedrock and extending about halfway to the surface. Most common under ocean floors.
Rare, sparsely populated clouds of ore extending over several chunks. Found only under oceans.
Small clusters of ore scattered evenly from bedrock about halfway to the surface. This is the vanilla lapis lazuli generation.

Choice.description: No lapis lazuli is generated at all.

OptionNumeric.name: lapisFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Lapis Lazuli distributions

OptionNumeric.name: lapisSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Lapis Lazuli distributions

Choice.Description: Short sloping tubes filled sparsely with emeralds and a few ... surprises. Vastly more common under open grassy hills.
Uncommon, sparsely populated clouds of ore covering roughly one chunk. Found only under open grassy hills.
Single blocks scattered near bedrock under open grassy highlands. This is the vanilla emerald generation.

Choice.description: No emeralds are generated at all.

Substitute.name: StandardOreSubstitute
Substitute.Description: Replace vanilla-generated ore clusters with stone.
Substitute.Comment: The global option harddeferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

StandardGen.name: CoalStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft coal distribution

Veins.name: CoalVeins
Veins.Description: Coal spawns just near the surface, and up into hills and mountains. The veins are long and thick, but sparsely filled with ore and often broken up by caves or depressions in the terrain.

Veins.name: CoalVeinsSwamp
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding coal in a swamp.

Cloud.name: CoalCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse coal cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in swamps.

StandardGen.name: IronStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft iron distribution

VeinsPreset.name: CustomizedBigIron
VeinsPreset.Description: Iron spawns in the height 30-50 range. The veins are average in length and size. Changes: 1. This is a preset. This is for defining some stuff and changing some defaults. 2. Motherlode is created, along with "Extra thin" veins at 15. 3. Then "normal" veins at 11 4. Then "thicker" veins at 6. 5. Finally, "thickest" (fixed radius of 1.8) .. Radius of 1.74-ish should be sufficient to guarantee no gaps even on diagonals. going to use a slightly larger amount just in case there is a turn at a diagonal gap. The "thickest" veins at 1 are supposed to be followable. 6. Base motherlode frequency is raised by a factor of 3. Seriously, before they were 1/100th as common as normal veins; that's kinda crazy. To put it in perspective: a given biome blob (256 blocks by 256 blocks, or 16 chunks by 16 chunks, or 256 chunks on average) would expect less than one normal vein (every 400 chunks); the base for this is every 40,000 chunks or about every 125 biomes. This should be about every 40 biomes. Still crazy rare, but no longer insane.

VeinsPreset.name: CustomizedBigIronCold
VeinsPreset.Description: A climate zone is about 16 biomes. 5 times as common should have 1-2 of these per climate zone. Ideally, I'd make it one per, but the rarity of cold zones, and the likely chance of hitting the zero's ... EDIT: Or not; this is "cold", not "snowy", so the taiga forests are included. 5x may be too common then.

Cloud.name: IronCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse iron cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in cold biomes.

StandardGen.name: GoldStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft gold distribution

VeinsPreset.name: CustomizedBigGoldForest
VeinsPreset.Description: A climate zone is about 16 biomes. 5 times as common should have 1-2 of these per climate zone.

Cloud.name: GoldCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse gold cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in forest biomes.

StandardGen.name: RedstoneStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft redstone distribution

Veins.name: RedstoneVeins
Veins.Description: Isolated veins (no motherlodes) that run vertically. These veins are fairly common, but a challenge to mine because you have to tunnel straight down.

Veins.name: RedstoneVeinsDesert
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding redstone in deserts.

Cloud.name: RedstoneCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse redstone cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found in deserts.

StandardGen.name: DiamondStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft diamond distribution

Veins.name: DiamondVeins
Veins.Description: Short sparsely filled tubes starting at bedrock.

Veins.name: DiamondVeinsLava
Veins.Description: Fills center of each tube with lava, forming "kimberlite pipes"

Veins.name: DiamondVeinsSilverfish
Veins.Description: Surround the tubes with silverfish spawners.

Cloud.name: DiamondCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse diamond cloud with no internal density noise.

StandardGen.name: LapisLazuliStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft lapis lazuli distribution

Veins.name: LapisLazuliVeins
Veins.Description: Lapis Lazuli spawns in isolated veins that run vertically upward, much like redstone. However, lapis veins are too deep to break the suface except occassionally under oceans.

Veins.name: LapisLazuliVeinsOcean
Veins.Description: This roughly triples the chance of finding lapis lazuli under oceans.

Cloud.name: LapisLazuliCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse lapis lazuli cloud surrounded by single-block "hint" veins, found under oceans

StandardGen.name: EmeraldStandard
StandardGen.Description: Equivalent to vanilla minecraft diamond distribution

Veins.name: EmeraldVeins
Veins.Description: Short sparsely filled tubes. 5x more common in Extreme Hills.

Veins.name: EmeraldVeinsSilverfish
Veins.Description: Fill center of tubes with silverfish spawners. Credit: based on novel examples by AnonymousViking from the MC forums.

Cloud.name: EmeraldCloud
Cloud.Description: Diffuse emerald cloud with no internal density noise, found in extreme hills.
